messages.subject: cardboard box houses
messages.msgSnippet: My children have a book called Make it with Boxes by Joan Irvine. The publ. is Kids Can Press and the ISBN is 1-55074-056-3. It is a book full of fun ideas
messages.messageBody:
My children have a book called 'Make it with Boxes' by Joan Irvine. The
publ. is Kids Can Press and the ISBN is 1-55074-056-3.

It is a book full of fun ideas and starting points for using
boxes...everything from large stage sets and props to airplanes to pop-ups
and etc. Great fun...

Brooke in BC
brynlee@...

messages.subject: cardboard box houses
messages.msgSnippet: In New Zealand we have to be reviewed by the education authorities about every3 years or so (except that every 2-3 years they have a break for a few years,
messages.messageBody:
In New Zealand we have to be 'reviewed' by the education authorities about
every3 years or so (except that every 2-3 years they have a break for a few
years, cause they decide there's no need cause there are so few problems
with homeschoolers). Anyway, I was support person for my friend whose family
is really into building massive box constructions. So when the reviewer
arrived, the entire family room had the furniture pushed back against the
walls, and the rest of the romm filled with fridge / oven / freezer etc.
boxes all joined together with No-More-Nails glue! And the kids were firmly
ensconced inside <g>

Give the woman her dues: she kicked off her high-heeled shoes, and crawed in
in her tailored pale blue suit, laddering her stockings as she went, to talk
to them about what they had made!

Carol

Michele Moss wrote:

> From: "Michele Moss" <michele@...>
>
> > From: Naykki2@...
> >
> > What with the doll house, the Lincoln logs, my daughter's art
> > projects and the large, heavily decorated "house" made out of a
> > cardboard box, we give a rather.....busy first impression.
> >
> you mean i'm not the only one with a cardboard box house in my
> house? Sterling was having so much fun with the dryer box that hubby
> came home with one of those tall boxes that refrigerators are shipped
> in! it's been used lying on it's side as a bus, tractor trailer
> truck, train, etc, etc. fantastic imaginative fun!
>
> Michele
